Make an antigenic map from scratch

make.acmap.Rd

Make an antigenic map from scratch

make.acmap(
  number_of_dimensions = 2,
  number_of_optimizations = 100,
  minimum_column_basis = "none",
  fixed_column_bases = NULL,
  move_trapped_points = NULL,
  parallel_optimization = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE,
  vverbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

number_of_dimensions

The number of dimensions in the map
number_of_optimizations

The number of optimization runs to perform
minimum_column_basis

The minimum column basis for the map
move_trapped_points

How should removal of trapped points be performed (see details)
...

Value

Returns an antigenic map object of the corresponding class.

Details

Hunting for and removal of trapped points can be performed for either none of the optimization runs ("none"), all of the optimization runs ("all") or only the best one found ("best").

See also

Other map optimization functions: moveTrappedPoints(), optimizeMap(), randomizeCoords(), relaxMapOneStep(), relaxMap()

Examples

# Read in an acmap object from a file
map_file_path <- system.file("extdata/h3map2004.ace", package = "Racmacs")
map <- read.acmap(map_file_path)

# Read in a table of titer data and make a new acmap file from it
titer_file_path <- system.file("extdata/h3map2004_hitable.csv", package = "Racmacs")
titer_data <- read.titerTable(titer_file_path)
map <- acmap.cpp(table = titer_data)
